title: As an Android fan, thereโs only one iOS feature I want Google to copy
summary: Appleโs seamless iPhone-to-iPhone migration is the gold standard that Google still hasnโt matched for Android in 2026.
body: Android has long reached a point of maturity where it does a whole lot of things right for most of its user base. However, thereโs always room for improvement, and one area that still frustrates me as an Android user is the process of migrating to a new phone. After using the past few generations of iPhones, Iโve noticed how excellently seamless and straightforward Appleโs iPhone migration process is, and itโs one of the first things I miss when I switch back to Android flagships. Google, itโs 2026, and itโs high time you copied Appleโs simplicity in migration. Apple gets iPhone-to-iPhone transfers just right
